text: او تقول لو ان الله هدىنى لكنت من المتقين

translations.translation: or lest they should say, 'If only Allah had guided me, I would have had taqwa,'
Or say: "If only God had guided me I would have been a man of fear and piety;"
and lest a person should say: “If only Allah had guided me, I should have been one of the God-fearing”;
Or before the soul says, "Had God guided me, I could have been a pious man".
Or (so that no soul) may say, “If Allah had shown me the right path, I would then be among the pious!”
Or (lest) he should say: "If only Allah had guided me, I should indeed have been among those who have Taqwa."
Or it should say: Had Allah guided me, I would certainly have been of those who guard (against evil);
or lest it should say, 'If only God had guided me, I should have been or lest among the godfearing,'
Or should say: If Allah had but guided me I should have been among the dutiful!
Or, "If only God had guided me, I would surely have joined the God-fearing."
Or, lest it should say: had Allah but guided me, I should surely have been of the God-fearing!
Or say, ‘Had Allah guided me I would have surely been among the Godwary!’
Or (lest) it should say: 'If only Allah had guided me, I should certainly have been among the righteous!'-
Or (lest) he should say: "If only Allah had guided me, I should indeed have been among the Muttaqun (pious and righteous persons - see V. 2:2)."
Or, lest it should say: 'If Allah had only guided me I would have been one of the cautious'
Or say, “Had God guided me; I would have been of the pious.”
Or [lest] it say, "If only Allah had guided me, I would have been among the righteous."
[39:57] or [before] that it should say, ‘If only God had guided me, to obedience and I had become guided, I would have been among those who have feared’, His chastisement;

commentaries.author: ابن عباس
commentaries.text: أَوْ تَقُولَ لَوْ أَنَّ اللَّهَ هَدَانِي لَكُنْتُ مِنَ الْمُتَّقِينَ (57) ومعنى { أو تقول لو أن الله هداني لكنت من المتقين } إنهم يقولونه لقصد الاعتذار والتنصل ، تعيد أذهانهم ما اعتادوا الاعتذار به للنبيء صلى الله عليه وسلم كما حكَى الله عنهم : { وقالوا لو شاء الرحمان ما عبدناهم } \[ الزخرف : 20 \] وهم كانوا يقولونه لقصد إفحام النبي حين يدعوهم فبَقيَ ذلك التفكير عالقاً بعقولهم حين يُحضرون للحساب . والكلام في مِنَ المُتَّقين } مثلُه في { من الساخرين } .

translations.translation: (Or should say) and that it will not say: (if Allah had but guided me) if Allah had showed me faith (I should have been among the dutiful) I would have been among those who believe in Allah's divine Oneness!

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
{ لكنتُ من المتقين }: من الذين يتقون الشرك
 قال الإمام أبو منصور: هذا الكافر أعرفُ بهداية الله من المعتزلة
 وكذلك أولئك الكفرة
 الذين قالوا لأتباعهم:
[إبراهيم: 21] يقولون: لو وفقنا الله للهداية
 وأعطانا الهدى لدعوناكم إليه
 ولكن عَلِمَ منا اختيار الضلالة والغواية فخذلنا ولم يوفقنا
 والمعتزلة يقولون: بل هداهم وأعطاهم التوفيق لكنهم لم يهتدوا
 انظر النسفي
 { أو تقولَ حين ترى العذابَ لو أن لي كرةً } أي: رجعة للدنيا
